data.title: Improving the sample build task template
data.body:
Fixes #35352

This PR improves the default "others" build task template to include an options group that declares the new task as the default build task. This will expose this "feature" to users, helping them correctly declare a default build task and eliminate the "No build tasks found" toast.

data.title: Improving sample build task template to "solve" the "No build tasks found" message

milestone.title: On Deck
milestone.description:
The Issues assigned to the **On Deck** milestone under consideration for the upcoming milestones.
Our goal is to always have less than 100 Issues on deck.

data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.6.1
- OS Version: Win10 170927

## Issue:

VSCode doesn't recognize build tasks created from VSCode's built-in templates, displaying the "No build task found" toast. This can be quickly remedied by improving the task templates. See below.

This is a continuation of #7877.

## Steps to Reproduce:

1. Working on Jekyll website project with no built-in VSCode build support
1. Hit CTRL + SHIFT + B to start build
1. See "No Build Task Found" info toast
1. Hit "Configure Build Task" button on toast bar
1. Offered 4 task runner options, choose "Others" to run external build command
1. HIt CTRL + SHIFT + B to test newly generated build task

Expected: Newly generated build task should run
Actual: "No build task found" toast is displayed again

Reproduces without extensions: Yes

## Proposed Fix: 
Update task templates to include group options that indicate the task is the default build task

```javascript
            "group": {
                "kind": "build",
                "isDefault": true
            }
```

Fix PR incoming.

data.title: File extension specific settings
data.body:
This was discussed here:
https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/1587

but instead what was implemented was language specific settings. That doesn't help us where we have the same language in files with different extensions but what to impose different settings on them.

(ex. I have a DSL like language that looks like JS, I want to make it syntax highlight as JS, but disable validation because some things aren't quit right. Having to fork the JS language bindings for that and maintain it is unfortunate.)

data.title: cursorColumnSelect* functions have multple keyboard mappings creating many conflicts.
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: Win7 

Steps to Reproduce:

`Shift-Alt-Down` used to map to **Copy Line Down**. 
It's now overriden by a conflicting **cursorColumnSelectDown**

1. Open Keyboard Shortcuts.
2. Search for "Shift+Alt+DownArrow"
3. Displays the conflicted mapping to both **Copy Line Down**.  and **cursorColumnSelectDown**

4. Search for "cursorColumnSelect" prefix and you'll see all of these functions have multiple key mappings that I've confirmed are creating even more conflicts.

5. I Removed all cursorColumnSelect* keymappings that used Shift-Alt-* but retained the Ctrl-Shift-Alt-* mappings.

See also https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/29327

data.title: filters.ts' matchesSubString() performs badly in some cases
data.body:
E.g., matchesSubString('aaaaaaaaaaaax', 'aaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaaa') calls _matchesSubString() 38 million times due to the backtracking being done.

This is used for the fuzzy highlighting in QuickOpen. It seems to have been there for some time, not a recent regression.

/fyi @bpasero

data.title: feature-request: Lock display of (multiple) SCM providers
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.17.0-insider
- OS Version: win10

On the latest scm repository view, I understand that you can select multiple repositories to get the previously implemented multi-view.  However, the selection is constantly being removed, requiring reselecting of the scm providers.

It would be nice to be able to lock the scm to be selected such that it remembers that lock the next time vscode is launched, or in the other cases I've had when it 'forgets'
a small lock/unlock icon-button in the entry in providers list and/or the top level bar of the particular provider would be a nice UX, but even an entry in the `...` list would be fine.

data.title: diff view tab: cursor always resets to top of file
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code 1.16.1 (27492b6bf3acb0775d82d2f87b25a93490673c6d, 2017-09-14T16:38:23.027Z)
- OS Version: Windows_NT x64 10.0.15063
- Extensions: 

Extension|Author (truncated)|Version
---|---|---
cpptools|ms-|0.13.0
team|ms-|1.122.0



---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. create a diff-view tab (e.g by double-clicking on a file in the SCM sidebar)
2. scroll down in the diff-view, place the cursor somewhere in the middle of the file
3. switch to another tab and then back again
4. notice that the diff-view has scrolled back to the top of the file...

Diff-view editing is my primary workflow, so this bug makes VS code almost unusable for me :o(

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: First F5 fails without a problem matcher in tasks.json
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.17.0-insider (f7962f0682a76516df51de4856f8ccc5d8ad578a, 2017-09-20T05:10:59.524Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 16.7.0

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Use `yo code` to create a simple extension
![image001](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/11282622/30991949-33335834-a45c-11e7-8363-19bf0da89830.png)
1. Open the new extension in code
1. Open tasks.json and remove the problemMatcher
1. F5
 
Expected: debugger starts
Actual: debugger does not start. However debugger will start on *2nd* F5

More context: I don't expect users to remove the problem matcher in this scenario, but it just illustrates the problem. I have a different project that has the same structure (a launch.json file referencing a background 'preLaunchTask' in tasks.json), but no problem matcher exists that I could use.

data.title: New "outputCapture" node2 launch config prop warns "is not allowed"
data.body: Needs to be added to the config registration in vscode-node-debug

data.title: Add control to open file shown in "replace preview" editor when performing project-wide find/replace
data.body:
While performing a project-wide find/replace, opening an occurrence from the search sidebar opens a "replace preview" diff editor. This view is not editable, so if the user would like to edit the displayed file, the only current way to do so is manually either from the explorer sidebar or the quick-open palette.

Per @roblourens' suggestion in #35323, "There should be a working Open File button that always appears, git repo or not, in the replace diff editor."

data.title: Support lookaround for find/replace even if slow
data.body:
One of the most common use cases I have for using regex when performing a find/replace is to be able to search for words that are not preceded or followed by another word. For example, I'd like to find any word that ends with "Model" unless it ends with "ViewModel".

If I'm understanding the documentation correctly, this is currently not possible.

What would it take to support this? I could really use this even if searches of this type were slower.

data.title: Type information is not picked up from .mjs files for "IntelliSense"
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.16.1
- OS Version: *

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Create `a.mjs`:

```
    /** @param {string} name */
    export default function a(name) {
      return 'hi'
    }
```

2. Create `use-it.js`:

```
    import a from './a.mjs'

    // Then...
```

3. ...type `a(`
4. No useful "IntelliSense"
5. Renaming `a.mjs` to `a.js` results in useful "IntelliSense"


<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: Copy/Paste Police
data.body:
* the copy/paste detector from https://www.npmjs.com/package/jscpd
* run it `src/vs` like so `jscpd --path . --languages typescript --exclude **/*.test.ts -l 50` which will search for more than 50 duplicated lines
* see the output below

I believe the first two are just because of d.ts-stunts, but I believe the latter two are real. Please check.

```
jrieken:~/Code/vscode/src/vs$ jscpd --path . --languages typescript --exclude **/*.test.ts -l 50
info:    jscpd - copy/paste detector for programming source code, developed by Andrey Kucherenko
info:    Preprocessors running time: durationMs=352
info:    Scanning 1101 files for duplicates...
info:    Scanning for duplicates time: durationMs=21672
info:    Scanning... done!

info:    Start report generation...

info:    Found 4 exact clones with 357 duplicated lines in 7 files

	- /Users/jrieken/Code/vscode/src/vs/base/common/keyCodes.ts: 14-162
	 /Users/jrieken/Code/vscode/src/vs/editor/common/standalone/standaloneBase.ts: 51-199

	- /Users/jrieken/Code/vscode/src/vs/base/common/keyCodes.ts: 18-99
	 /Users/jrieken/Code/vscode/src/vs/monaco.d.ts: 176-257

	- /Users/jrieken/Code/vscode/src/vs/editor/standalone/browser/accessibilityHelp/accessibilityHelp.ts: 175-232
	 /Users/jrieken/Code/vscode/src/vs/workbench/parts/codeEditor/electron-browser/accessibility.ts: 138-195

	- /Users/jrieken/Code/vscode/src/vs/workbench/services/search/node/ripgrepTextSearch.ts: 301-372
	 /Users/jrieken/Code/vscode/src/vs/workbench/services/search/node/worker/searchWorker.ts: 298-369


 0.11% (357 lines) duplicated lines out of 313341 total lines of code.

warn:    output file is not provided
info:    Generate report time: durationMs=14
info:    All time: durationMs=22047
```

data.title: Broken intellisense for C++
data.body:
<!-- Do you have a question? Please ask it on http://stackoverflow.com/questions/tagged/vscode. -->

<!-- Use Help > Report Issues to prefill these. -->
- VSCode Version: 1.17.0-insider
- OS Version: macOS 10.13

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open VScode
2. Open a C++ source file
3. Try to get Intellisense suggestions

A prompt says "C++ language server has crashed 5 times won't be restarted" or similar and then no intellisense even after restarting code, only the tag parser results come up.

(Not sure if I should have filed this with https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-cpptools, but since their last commit was 10 days ago, I think the problem is with VSCode and not the extension)

<!-- Launch with `code --disable-extensions` to check. -->
Reproduces without extensions: Yes

data.title: There is a way to crypt extension?
data.body: Hi all, i wonder if there is a way to build and crypt extension or lock his content from being extracted. I know that renaming a `.vsix` file to `.zip` can be easily extracted.

data.title: Two commands 'Configure Recommended Extensions' that do the same
data.body:
1.17 insiders

- open vscode on a folder
- open the content menu, type Configure Recommended Extensions
  there are two menu actions:
 Configure Recommended Extensions (Workspace)
 Configure Recommended Extensions (Workspace Folder)

In the single folder setup it makes no sense to have both commands. I found it confusing.

What about a single command that prompts where to create the recommendations? There's already a prompt for the Workspace Folder case.
Note if there is only one option (e.g. in the folder case), no prompt is needed.
